If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

### PR summary [3670df8dc1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14945/commits/3670df8dc1665c29d4999395741109c482e391ad)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Basis.smul_det`
`+ LinearMap.toMatrix_smulBasis_left`
`+ LinearMap.toMatrix_smulBasis_right`
`+ coe_smul`
`+ instance : MulAction G (Basis ι R M)`
`+ instance : SMul G (Basis ι R M)`
`+ instance [SMul G G'] [IsScalarTower G G' M] : IsScalarTower G G' (Basis ι R M)`
`+ instance [SMulCommClass G G' M] : SMulCommClass G G' (Basis ι R M)`
`+ repr_smul`
`+ smul_apply`
`+ smul_eq_map`
`+ smul_leftMulMatrix`
`+ toMatrix_smul_left`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

There is a build error, otherwise LGTM, thanks!

bors d+

:v: eric-wieser can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
@eric-wieser can you please fix the error? Thanks!
Per Zulip, it will require some renaming

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#15036~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

bors merge

(@YaelDillies told me the new lemmas look fine)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10117603245/job/27982922365)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10117603245/job/27982922784)

This looks good, except that as mentioned in PM it doesn't work for the action of `Rˣ` on `R` when `R` is noncommutative. I think that's fine to not include that for now, but maybe leave a TODO.

maintainer merge

This looks good, except that as mentioned in PM it doesn't work for the action of `Rˣ` on `R` when `R` is noncommutative. I think that's fine to not include that for now, but maybe leave a TODO.

maintainer merge
Just for my own understanding, what's the rule/is there a rule preferring `[SMulCommClass G R M]` over `[SMulCommClass R G M]`?
It's arbitrary, the rule is "pick the one that Lean complained was missing".
😆 okay but you are (almost) always able to replace `smul_comm` by `← smul_comm` in which case it asks for the other one
With the extra rule "avoid picking both, and use `.symm` internally to construct the other one".
I guess aesthetically, I'd prefer to see `SMulCommClass G R M` when attaching a `G` action to something that has `R` and `M` involved in its type.
Yeah, that's my reasoning as well in #14863

```suggestion
@[norm_cast] theorem coe_smul (g : G) (b : Basis ι R M) : ⇑(g • b) = g • ⇑b := rfl
```

I think
```
instance [IsScalarTower G G' M] : IsScalarTower G G' (Basis ι R M)
```
also holds
I skipped it because I can't think of a case where it actually applies, but since you asked for it I've added it.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add `SMul` instances to `Basis`

|-|-|

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Basis.smul_det`
`+ LinearMap.toMatrix_smulBasis_left`
`+ LinearMap.toMatrix_smulBasis_right`
`+ coe_smul`
`+ instance : MulAction G (Basis ι R M)`
`+ instance : SMul G (Basis ι R M)`
`+ instance [SMul G G'] [IsScalarTower G G' M] : IsScalarTower G G' (Basis ι R M)`

## more verbose report:

</details>

This looks good, except that as mentioned in PM it doesn't work for the action of `Rˣ` on `R` when `R` is noncommutative. I think that's fine to not include that for now, but maybe leave a TODO.
